roleset.name: growth rate inverse to exponentiation (b to the y power equals x, with y being the log of x, logarithmic to x)

role.descr: logarithmic thing (includes the log, which is the number of times arg2 is multiplied against itself, or y in the above equation)
the base (number multiplied by itself arg1 times, b in the above equation)
the antilogarithm (result when arg3 is multiplied by itself arg2 times, number the log is 'of', x in the above equation)

example.name: logarithmic-j
example.text: From ( 7 ) we know the storage overhead in each participant is logarithmic to the number of participants in the same service group .

propbank.arg: the storage overhead in each participant
to the number of participants in the same service group

example.name: logarithmic-j
example.text: Gustav Fechner developed what is now called the Weber – Fechner law4 . It states that perceived intensity P is logarithmic to the stimulus intensity S ( above a minimal threshold of perception S0 ) – see box .

propbank.arg: ( above a minimal threshold of perception S0 )

roleset.note: LOGARITHMIC-J NOTES: Added by Julia for clearearth-earthquakes.
